meanings.definition: A large number of fish swimming together.
meanings.sent1: The shoal of fish moved gracefully through the water.
meanings.sent2: I saw a colorful shoal of fish while snorkeling.
meanings.sent3: The shoal of fish seemed to be having a party in the sea.
meanings.sent4: The shoal of fish shimmered like a moving rainbow.
meanings.sent5: The shoal of fish created a beautiful underwater spectacle.

meanings.definition: A sandbank or sandbar that makes the water shallow.
meanings.sent1: The boat got stuck on the shoal near the shore.
meanings.sent2: We had to be careful navigating around the shoal in the bay.
meanings.sent3: The seagulls rested on the shoal, enjoying the sun.
meanings.sent4: The setting sun cast a golden light on the shoal.
meanings.sent5: The children played in the shallow water near the shoal.

meanings.definition: To come together in a large group.
meanings.sent1: The students would shoal in the cafeteria during lunch.
meanings.sent2: People would shoal around the street performer to watch.
meanings.sent3: The birds would shoal in the park, chirping happily.
meanings.sent4: The clouds would shoal together before a storm.
meanings.sent5: The fans would shoal around the stage, waiting for the concert to start.
